awd_titl_txt: Doctoral Dissertation Research in Geography and Regional    Science
awd_abstract_narration: This doctoral dissertation award will support a study of the late          Quaternary climatic and phytogeographic history of the Arizona monsoon.         The purpose of the project is to provide information on the timing and          extent of the putative monsoonal maximum during the glacial-                    interglacial transition.                                                                                                                                             The project will add to our knowledge of the effects of human              activities on climate by illuminating the long-term fluctuations that           occurred prior to major human impacts.  It will contribute baseline             data needed to evaluate the variability of climate in the post-                 agricultural and industrial periods by establishing a good record of            climate over the U.S. Southwest during the Holocene.  The project will          enhance our understanding of potential desertification in this region           of the country as well as of effects of global climatic change.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
